(OOC: I'm baaack! Sorry I haven't been posting, but I had to study for the 
PSATs. I just took the test today, and Matrix help me I'll jump out a window 
before I take another standardized test^_^ Anywho, I'm gonna FINALLY post. 
It's kinof a delayed post, so It's gonna cover near past and present e-mails 
that are relevent to my char. If this post seems kinda odd then just chalk 
it up to good ol' sleep deprevation*_*)

Tavatron just watched as Iron Raptor and Prowl dragged Dinobot's lifeless 
form down the hall. There was absolutely nothing she could do to help. This 
was entirely out of her league. She soon found herself by her commanding 
officers, following them into the CR room. Her injured shoulder and various 
damage prevented her from offering some sort of assistance while they 
hoisted her fallen friend atop the steel table. A growing sense of worry and 
mild anger began to grow tie her stomach in knots.

*Why did he always do this?! Did he WANT to die?! Well, she wasn't about to 
lose her only friend, no matter what he had planned! He was NOT going to 
die. It's that simple.*

Tavatron sighed softly, her head dropping to her chest as she gazed at the 
various scratches and scuffs that marred the metallic floor. She was tired, 
tired of worrying, tired of fighting, tired of being angry. Unfortunetly, it 
was either fight or cry, and she didn't cry.

The voices of the surounding 'bots egan to blur and resound throughout the 
room. Everything just seemd to spin as Tavatron shut her optics and placed a 
steadying hand on the nearest wall. With a slight groan she shook the 
dizziness from her optics and tried to focus on her current surroundings. 
The spinning had stopped, but the artificial light seemed to grow in 
luminosity. The organic iris in her optics tried to refocus, but to no 
avail, the light was still too bright.

Tavatron stood in an out of the way corner, watching everything but saying 
nothing to any other 'bots:

"Computer, what are the extent of my injuries?"

IC: Missing shoulder armor, mech-fluid loss at 10%, optical damage at 25%, 
optic lasers non-functional, internal mechanics at 93%.

With a final shake Tavatron pushed herself up from her position against the 
wall and tried her best to make her way across the room. She paused 
momentarily, watching as Prowl took off in the direction of the mess hall 
and Iron Raptor attempted to weld Dinobot's chest.

The sparks coupled with the growing intensity of the overhead lights were 
enough to make her squint and shade her eys with her right hand. She 
couldn't stand this. She felt so... so... useless! Why hadn't she taken that 
course on medical repairs?! Or actual payed attenion during physiology 
class?! Perhaps then she could be doing more than standing here looking like 
a slaggin' idiot!

"I- I have to get out of here..."

Her voice was barely audible, the sound of welding metal and sharp commands 
overpowering her it considerably. Tavatron quickly exited the room, almost 
jogging. She couldn't take it any more, she hadto get out of here! She 
couldn't just stand there and watch her friend die! She had to do something, 
anything! Matrix help her, she'd pick a fight with Obliteratron if it meant 
taking her mind off the obvious problem!

The sound of her feet against the bare metal floor grew in volume as she 
quickened her pace. She finally made her way outside, with no recollection 
of ever leaving the CF. Right now, however, she didn't care. All she wanted 
to do was get away from everyone and everything. Finally her injuries and 
fatigue caught up with her as she slumped against a large boulder on a cliff 
overlooking a peaceful valley. Her breathing was short and rapid, and her 
shoulder had begun to throb and bleed anew.

Tavatron pulled her head back and gazed skyward, watching as a flock of what 
appeared to be crows flew overhead. A light cloud had drifted over the sun, 
offering her some relief from the growing heat. Tavatron shut her optics and 
just sat there, listening. Somewhere in her an internal program had somehow 
been activated, a counting device of some kind. It was counting down, to 
what she wasn't sure, but in a matter of cycles it would reach zero. Perhaps 
it had something to do with that message Dinobot had sent her.
